column4: hey guys, i've to ask you a question.. what does imply to create a link to a folder in /bin? example: "andrea@taglia:/bin$ ln -s /usr/java/bin java" ??
well, then you have a link in /usr/bin that's all
which is good if you want to have java in your path
but it isn't the same to add a export $/usr/java/jre1.5.0_02/bin
in bashrc, you add directories to your path. with the link, you add the link to your current path
either mohammed goes to the mountain, or the mountain comes to mohammed you know :)
why i have to do both the operations in order to make java operative?
ah, you're probably setting the $JAVA_HOME variable in bashrc, and the link is just to find the binary
which is not the same thing, again :)
the $JAVA_HOME is created in the bashrc file too
ok, step 3. that's so that your shell finds java. the link is probably for scripts and possibly the mozilla plugin
